description_html:
Bye, bye, Notion, Google Docs, Evernote, Keep, and Apple Notes. Plane Pages are here!

What is Pages?

Pages is exactly what it sounds like---just an open space for your thoughts, notes, and something more intentful.

With Pages, you can now start jotting down meeting notes, create docs for issues, and format for presentation. You see a table of contents on the right when you use headings and you can lock the page so it‚Äôs not accidentally editable.

How to get to Pages

Easy. Just find pages under any project on the left nav of your Plane workspace, click Create page, give your new page a cool name, like I have for this page, and start clacking away.No flipping screens, no copy-pasting from anywhere else, no additional hoops.

Like I said "Easy"

What can I do with Pages ?

Anything you want to write, you can write on Pages.

Want to format something a quote?
Easy.

  • How about a to-do list ?

  • How about another Item on the list ?

  • How about I stop being stupid ?

  • Bullets ? Yep.

    • Netsted bullets ? We got you.

      • Even more nesting in bullets? Sure.

  • And Tab or Shift + Tab work, too.

  1. Ah, yes, there‚Äôs numbered lists, too.

  2. And they align nicely so you don‚Äôt have to battle with the screen.

There's code snippets that can go as long or as short as you want and 
include API docs you want to reference. You can even copy code from 
somewhere and paste it inside Plane to have it show up like this.

There is a table too

You can also color rows
different from columns

Or color columns different

Let's upload an image and make this line a heading 3.

Yep. Genius.

Life is already great with Plane. but it gets a little better with Pages, right?

Give it a spin, tell us we were right... Or wrong. We will work to make Pages work for you.

description_html:
Bye, bye, Notion, Google Docs, Evernote, Keep, and Apple Notes. Plane Pages are here!

What is Pages?

Pages is exactly what it sounds like---just an open space for your thoughts, notes, and something more intentful.

With Pages, you can now start jotting down meeting notes, create docs for issues, and format for presentation. You see a table of contents on the right when you use headings and you can lock the page so it‚Äôs not accidentally editable.

How to get to Pages

Easy. Just find pages under any project on the left nav of your Plane workspace, click Create page, give your new page a cool name, like I have for this page, and start clacking away.No flipping screens, no copy-pasting from anywhere else, no additional hoops.

Like I said "Easy"

What can I do with Pages ?

Anything you want to write, you can write on Pages.

Want to format something a quote?
Easy.

  • How about a to-do list ?

  • How about another Item on the list ?

  • How about I stop being stupid ?

  • Bullets ? Yep.

    • Netsted bullets ? We got you.

      • Even more nesting in bullets? Sure.

  • And Tab or Shift + Tab work, too.

  1. Ah, yes, there‚Äôs numbered lists, too.

  2. And they align nicely so you don‚Äôt have to battle with the screen.

There's code snippets that can go as long or as short as you want and 
include API docs you want to reference. You can even copy code from 
somewhere and paste it inside Plane to have it show up like this.

There is a table too

You can also color rows
different from columns

Or color columns different

Let's upload an image and make this line a heading 3.

Yep. Genius.

Life is already great with Plane. but it gets a little better with Pages, right?

Give it a spin, tell us we were right... Or wrong. We will work to make Pages work for you.

description_html:
Welcome to your Wiki Home ‚Äî the central place for your company‚Äôs knowledge, culture, and documentation.

Use this space to share your mission, onboarding guides, product details, and everything your team needs to work better together.

üè¢ Company Home

üåç About Us

Write a short paragraph about your company ‚Äî what you do, who you serve, and why it matters.

Example: ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre a software company building tools that help teams plan, track, and collaborate efficiently.‚Äù

üöÄ Mission

Describe your company‚Äôs core mission or north star.

Example: ‚ÄúOur mission is to simplify project management for modern teams.‚Äù

üí° Vision

What future are you building toward?

Example: ‚ÄúTo create a world where every team, big or small, can move ideas to impact faster.‚Äù

üíé Values & Culture

List your company‚Äôs guiding principles ‚Äî the DNA behind how you work.

  • Transparency ‚Äì Open communication and shared context.

  • Craftsmanship ‚Äì We take pride in building with quality.

  • Simplicity ‚Äì Clear systems scale better than complex ones.

  • Empathy ‚Äì People first, always.

  • Progress ‚Äì Continuous improvement over perfection.

‚úè Tip: Add links to internal documents like ‚ÄúCompany Values‚Äù or ‚ÄúCulture Manifesto.‚Äù

üîê Security & Compliance

Document your security posture, data handling, and compliance policies.

  • Access management

  • Data privacy practices

  • Backup & recovery policies

  • Compliance certifications

‚ö† Remember to restrict visibility for sensitive content.

üåà Customize Your Wiki

This Wiki Home is a starting point ‚Äî make it your own!

  • Add your logo and brand colors

  • Reorder or rename sections

  • Link your projects, modules, or documents

  • Invite your team to start contributing

‚ú® Tip: Wikis work best when they‚Äôre living documents. Keep them updated as your company evolves.
